channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nikola founder Trevor Milton is fighting a subpoena from his bankrupt company’s creditors
item.description: The recently-pardoned founder of Nikola, Trevor Milton, has been fighting a subpoena from the creditors of his bankrupt electric trucking company.

item.title: 'Ballerina' Deserves an Oscar Nod for Stunts—But It’ll Never Get One

item.title: Conspiracy World Thinks the Musk-Trump Breakup Is a 'Psyop'
item.description: As Elon Musk and Donald Trump feuded, conspiracy theorists assured their followers it was all a show. "5D chess at its finest, baby—checkmate!” procla...

item.title: Whoop MG Review: A Screenless Tracker With Cardiac Measurements
item.description: Years after its debut, the new Whoop band is still a uniquely designed tracker with distinctive health offerings.

item.title: Peloton explores placing its equipment in gyms, launches marketplace for used gear

item.title: 5 Best Mushroom Gummies (2025), WIRED-Tested and Approved
item.description: These edibles made from functional fungi are not your childhood Flintstone vitamins.

item.title: Barry Diller Invented Prestige TV. Then He Conquered the Internet
item.description: The mogul behind Fox, Expedia, and Tinder opens up about Steve Jobs—and his close friend Sam Altman.

item.title: Startup Battlefield 200: Only 3 days left to apply

item.title: Creator Caucus launches in Congress with support from Patreon, YouTube
item.description: The Congressional Creator Caucus will work to support the creator economy, which is estimated to be worth half-a-trillion dollars by 2027.
